change.description: Place meteg before qamats on initial he, placing a Combining Grapheme Joiner (CGJ, x034f) after it to force mark order
change.refuni: he qamats meteg alef hataf-patah dalet qamats mem qamats meteg he sof-pasuq
change.changeuni: he meteg combining-grapheme-joiner qamats alef hataf-patah dalet qamats mem qamats meteg he sof-pasuq

change.description: Change hatef patah under het to patah.
change.refuni: alef patah het hataf-patah resh tsere munah yod
change.changeuni: alef patah het patah resh tsere munah yod

change.refuni: vav patah yod dagesh holam munah alef mem dagesh segol resh
change.changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh holam munah alef mem segol resh

notes.note: The dagesh is redish, but well-positioned.

change.description: Move upper dot from qof to vav.
change.refuni: vav dagesh bet sheva qof upper-dot vav dagesh mem qamats meteg he dagesh sof-pasuq
change.changeuni: vav dagesh bet sheva qof vav upper-dot dagesh mem qamats meteg he dagesh sof-pasuq

notes.note: Masora circles are over the qof and the mem; the upper dot is the mark above the vav.

change.refuni: vav patah meteg yod dagesh patah het hataf-patah bet holam shin shin-dot pashta
change.changeuni: vav patah meteg yod patah het hataf-patah bet holam shin shin-dot pashta

notes.note: The yod has a hint of a dagesh; however, it's low, light, and attached to the yod.

change.description: Move mahpakh from vav to yod.
change.refuni: vav patah mahapakh yod dagesh holam alef mem segol resh
change.changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh holam mahapakh alef mem segol resh

change.description: The split into two words is correct; add note 'c'.
change.refuni: pe dagesh merkha vav holam tet hiriq yod
change.changeuni: pe dagesh merkha vav holam tet hiriq yod

notes.note: The two Egyptian names פוטיפר and פוטיפרע are similar, but have different word divisions based on their accents and Masorah Parva (Mp) notes in the margins.

The following translations are from The Contemporary Torah, JPS, 2006, available as the English translation at the "Sefaria: Miqra according to the Masorah" link. פוטיפר is written Potiphar, and described as "a courtier of Pharaoh and his prefect." Potiphar occurs twice: Gen 37:36.6 and 39:1.5. פוטיפרע is written Poti-phera and described as "priest of On". Poti-phera occurs 3 times: Gen 41:45.12, 41:50.14, and 46:20.10.

The LC text displays both פוטיפר and פוטיפרע without spacing indicating word divisions. However, both the accents and the Mp notes indicate that פוטיפרע, Poti-phera, should be considered as two words: פוטי פרע.
When the LC text displays the 2 Potiphar cases פוטיפר has a single primary accent; when the LC text displays the three Poti-phera cases both פוטי and פרע have a single primary accent. Breuer suggests that the primary accents are the masorete's way to indicate separate words within the text (since it would have been very difficult for the masorete to insert a space between them after the consonants were written). Gen 41:45 and 41:50 are also accompanied by Mp notes תרתין מילין כתׄ ("Written as two words"). The Poti-phera case in Gen 46:20.10 does not have a similar Mp note, but has primary accents on both פוטי and פרע.
The UXLC follows the accents and Mp notes; it represents all 3 Poti-phera cases as word pairs.

change.description: The split into two words is correct; add note 'c'.
change.refuni: pe dagesh merkha vav holam tet hiriq yod
change.changeuni: pe dagesh merkha vav holam tet hiriq yod

notes.note: The two Egyptian names פוטיפר and פוטיפרע are similar, but have different word divisions based on their accents and Masorah Parva (Mp) notes in the margins.

The LC text displays both פוטיפר and פוטיפרע without spacing indicating word divisions. However, both the accents and the Mp notes indicate that פוטיפרע, Poti-phera, should be considered as two words: פוטי פרע.
When the LC text displays the 2 Potiphar cases פוטיפר has a single primary accent; when the LC text displays the three Poti-phera cases both פוטי and פרע have a single primary accent. Breuer suggests that the primary accents are the masorete's way to indicate separate words within the text (since it would have been very difficult for the masorete to insert a space between them after the consonants were written). Gen 41:45 and 41:50 are also accompanied by Mp notes תרתין מילין כתׄ ("Written as two words"). The Poti-phera case in Gen 46:20.10 does not have a similar Mp note, but has primary accents on both פוטי and פרע.
The UXLC follows the accents and Mp notes; it represents all 3 Poti-phera cases as word pairs.

change.description: Possible dagesh on first nun, add note 't'. No text change.
change.refuni: alef tsere yod nun segol pashta nun dagesh vav dagesh pashta
change.changeuni: alef tsere yod nun segol pashta nun dagesh vav dagesh pashta

notes.note: The dagesh in the LC is well-positioned, poorly shaped.

change.refuni: vav dagesh pe qubuts vav dagesh qamats tipeha he
change.changeuni: vav dagesh pe qubuts vav dagesh qamats tipeha he

notes.note: The qamats is nearly invisible.
The tipeha is very late, but clearly belongs to the nun.

change.changeuni: pe dagesh merkha vav holam tet hiriq yod

change.changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq tav tsere qadma final-nun

change.changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq qof dagesh patah qadma het

change.changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq qof dagesh patah mahapakh het

change.changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq tav dagesh sheva nun mahapakh vav dagesh

change.changeuni: bet dagesh qamats merkha lamed vav dagesh lamed

notes.note: A merkha can not be on the bet for vocalization; it belongs on the lamed. The mark in the LC is ill-positioned.

Approved vowel

A qamats is unexpected here.

Very, very slight evidence of a maqef between the yod and the bet.
Add t וְאַ֣חֲרֵי
Approved vowel

Num 33 14 3
Daniel Holman daniel.holman@mail.com true

וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙> vav patah meteg yod dagesh patah het hataf-patah nun vav dagesh pashta וַֽיַחֲנוּ֙> vav patah meteg yod patah het hataf-patah nun vav dagesh pashta
The yod appears on top of a splotch in the paper. A slight darkening in that splotch might be a yod. A dagesh on the yod is expected, however.
Add t וַֽיַ
Approved vowel
14
Num 34 28 5
Daniel Holman daniel.holman@mail.com true
Possible dagesh in he, add note 't'.
Folio_097A 3 25 Credit: Sefaria.org.
פְּדַהְאֵ֖ל> pe dagesh sheva dalet patah he sheva alef tsere tipeha lamed פְּדַהְאֵ֖ל> pe dagesh sheva dalet patah he sheva alef tsere tipeha lamed
A possible dagesh appears in the he. It is well-positioned, but light, with a darker portion to the northeast. A dagesh in the he (mapiq) is unlikely here.
Add t פְּדַהְ
Approved NoTextChange

No dagesh apparent although one is expected grammatically.
Add t וַֽיִ
Approved vowel

2022.04.07

Deut 1 42 14
Daniel Holman daniel.holman@mail.com true
Change meteg to munah on nun.

תִּנָּֽגְפ֔וּ tav dagesh hiriq nun dagesh qamats meteg gimel sheva pe zaqef-qatan vav dagesh תִּנָּ֣גְפ֔וּ tav dagesh hiriq nun dagesh qamats munah gimel sheva pe zaqef-qatan vav dagesh
The munah is clear, however, the word already has a zaqef-qatan.
Approved accent
2
Deut 5 3 10
Daniel Holman daniel.holman@mail.com true
Change revia on tav to zaqef-qatan.

אִתָּ֗נוּ alef hiriq tav dagesh qamats revia nun vav dagesh אִתָּ֔נוּ alef hiriq tav dagesh qamats zaqef-qatan nun vav dagesh
The lower dot of the zaqef-qatan is damaged, but dark and well-positioned.
Approved accent

Daniel Holman daniel.holman@mail.com true
Place munah before mahapakh on first shin; add note 'c'.
Folio_102B 1 15 Credit: Sefaria.org.
שֵׁ֤֣שֶׁת shin shin-dot tsere mahapakh munah shin shin-dot segol tav שֵׁ֣֤שֶׁת shin shin-dot tsere munah mahapakh shin shin-dot segol tav
Add c שֵׁ֣֤
The LC mark order, munah-then-mahapakh, is likely to be out of the usual lower-then-upper trope mark order.
Approved accent

The LC mark order, munah-then-tipeha, is likely to be out of the usual lower-then-upper trope mark order.

בְּשַׁלֵּֽחֲךָ֙ bet dagesh sheva shin shin-dot patah lamed dagesh tsere meteg het hataf-patah final-kaf qamats pashta בְּשַׁלֵּֽחֲךָ֨ bet dagesh sheva shin shin-dot patah lamed dagesh tsere meteg het hataf-patah final-kaf qamats qadma
A qadma better represents the mark on the final-kaf .

The accent on the nun is probably a tipeha. The next change, Deut 17:18.15, is compatible with this change.

Change accent on nun to merkha; add note 't'.
Folio_110A 1 22 Credit: Sefaria.org.
הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים he patah kaf dagesh holam he hataf-patah nun hiriq tipeha yod final-mem הַכֹּהֲנִ֥ים he patah kaf dagesh holam he hataf-patah nun hiriq merkha yod final-mem
The accent on the nun is probably a merkha. The previous change, Deut 17:18.14, is compatible with this change. This additional change was suggested by Benjamin Denckla.
Add t הַכֹּהֲנִ֥
Approved accent

Deut 29 19 14
Daniel Holman daniel.holman@mail.com true
Add maqaf; add note 'c'.
Folio_117A 1 2 Credit: Sefaria.org.
וְרָ֤בְצָה vav sheva resh qamats mahapakh bet sheva tsadi qamats he וְרָ֤בְצָה־ vav sheva resh qamats mahapakh bet sheva tsadi qamats he maqaf
The maqaf is unexpected as this word and the following word both have accents. The presence of a maqaf here in the LC is disputed among scholars.
Add c וְרָ֤בְצָה־
Approved vowel
